sort_compare¶

A data minipulation file which times each sorting algorithm on ten sorts of randomly generated data and

graphs the resulting times for ease of comparison. Note that radix sort is kept from the graphs as the time disparity caused the other bars to be invisibly small. The full raw data is shown in stats/sorting_results.txt. Graphs are stored in stats/plots

compare()¶

Compares all sorts in oter_sorts with wasteland_sort

Returns

None. Puts plots in stats/plots and running time averages in ./sorting_results.txt

heap(data: List[list]) → List[float]¶

Runs timing trials for Heapsort over ‘data’.

Parameters

data – List of data to be sorted

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

merge(data: List[list]) → List[float]¶

Runs timing trials for Mergesort over ‘data’.

Parameters

data – List of data to be sorted

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

Runs timing trials for Quicksort over ‘data’.

Parameters

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

Runs timing trials for Radix sort over ‘data’.

Parameters

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

Runs timing trials for Timsort over ‘data’.

Parameters

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

wasteland(data: List[list]) → List[float]¶

Runs timing trials for Wasteland sort over ‘data’.

Parameters

Returns

List of average sorting times for each set of data

data_from_stats(data: List[list]) → List[list]¶

Takes a list of all samples generated in compare() and separates them into data sets

Parameters

data – List of data to be sorted

Returns

List of lists of integers. Each list of lists represents a set of data (e.g. small, medium, large)

wasteland_sort
